title: Virtuous circle: Work from Ansys on plastics recycling - Develop3D
summary: The article discusses a collaboration to use recycled plastics in products, focusing on simulation to optimize properties and designs for sustainable outcomes.
green_innovation: TRUE - The article describes a collaboration that aims to use recycled plastics in products, leveraging simulation technology to optimize materials and designs for sustainability, aligning with the principles of green innovation.
business_innovation: TRUE - The collaboration between Ansys, recycling companies, and an automotive parts producer to optimize the use of recycled plastics through simulation technology represents a new approach and process in the market, meeting the criteria of business innovation.
green_product: TRUE - The article details the development and utilization of recycled plastics in products designed to reduce environmental impact, improve sustainability, and promote eco-friendly practices, aligning with the characteristics of a green product.
green_process: TRUE - The use of simulation technology to optimize the properties of recycled plastics and design processes for sustainable outcomes reflects a method that minimizes environmental impacts and promotes sustainability, meeting the definition of a green process.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 541511 - Custom Computer Programming Services, 562920 - Materials Recovery Facilities, 325991 - Custom Compounding of Purchased Plastics Resins, 326199 - All Other Plastics Product Manufacturing
greenwashing: FALSE - The article does not suggest any false or misleading claims regarding environmental benefits of the product or process innovation; instead, it focuses on a collaborative effort to enhance sustainability through recycled plastics and simulation technology.

summary: Current recycling practices are inadequate due to limited capacity, with much plastic waste piling up globally. A report highlights the spread of toxins through plastic recycling and the release of microplastics into the environment. The article advocates for preventative measures like reducing new plastic production, reusing existing plastics, and exploring alternative materials.
green_innovation: TRUE. The article discusses the need for innovative approaches to address the environmental challenges of plastic waste management, such as reducing production, promoting reuse, and exploring alternative materials, which align with green innovation goals.
business_innovation: FALSE. The article focuses more on environmental and waste management aspects related to plastics rather than on introducing new products or processes as part of a business innovation.

title: Restaurants In Unincorporated LA County Are Now Banned From Using Plastics. What To Know About The New ... - LAist
summary: L.A. County implemented a new plastics ordinance to ban single-use plastics in restaurants in unincorporated areas, primarily targeting plastic waste reduction to combat pollution and climate change.
green_innovation: TRUE - The article discusses the implementation of a plastics ordinance that aims to reduce plastic waste, combat pollution, and address the climate impact, aligning with environmental sustainability goals.
business_innovation: FALSE - The article discusses a regulatory measure (plastics ordinance) rather than a new or improved product or business process introduced by a firm.
green_product: TRUE - The article refers to the implementation of a plastics ordinance that aims to reduce plastic waste, promote sustainable practices, and protect the environment, making it a green product.
green_process: TRUE - The article discusses the adoption of green practices in the form of a plastics ordinance that focuses on reducing environmental impacts, promoting sustainability, and addressing climate issues.

title: Victoria's Secret isn't keeping its 'Forever Bra' a secret - The Cool Down
summary: The article discusses Victoria's Secret's Forever Bra, made with recyclable materials that allow for reusing and recycling, striving to keep materials out of landfills and contribute to sustainability.
green_innovation: TRUE The Forever Bra innovation aligns with green innovation as it promotes sustainability by using recyclable materials and facilitating the recycling process, which reduces environmental impact.
business_innovation: TRUE The Forever Bra by Victoria's Secret represents a business innovation as it introduces a new product with significant differences from traditional bras, emphasizing sustainability and circular economy principles.
green_product: TRUE The Forever Bra qualifies as a green product due to its design and material usage, focusing on recyclability, use of eco-friendly materials like modal from responsibly managed forests, and aiming to reduce waste in the textile industry.
green_process: TRUE The process of creating the Forever Bra involves green practices such as using recyclable materials, ensuring easy recycling of the product, and converting non-recyclable parts into energy, thus minimizing environmental impacts.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 315999 (Other Apparel Accessories and Other Apparel Manufacturing), 424340 (Footwear Merchant Wholesalers), 452311 (Department Stores), 453998 (All Other Miscellaneous Store Retailers)
greenwashing: FALSE The article does not exhibit greenwashing as it transparently describes the sustainable features of the Forever Bra without misleading claims.
